content:
My relationships with others have definitely changed since I started prioritizing my needs and setting boundaries. I've noticed that I'm more assertive and confident in communicating my needs, which has led to more honest and open conversations with others. I'm not afraid to say no or set limits, which has actually improved my relationships in the long run.

I've also noticed that I'm more selective about the people I surround myself with and the activities I engage in. I'm more mindful of how I'm spending my time and energy, and I'm making choices that align with my values and priorities.

One of the biggest changes has been in my relationship with my partner. We had a really tough conversation about my mental health and how it was affecting our relationship, but it ended up being a turning point for us. They've been more understanding and supportive since then, and we've been working together to find ways to support each other.

It's not always easy, and there are still times when I struggle to
